intro: Drymaria jenniferae, commonly known as the dwarf silverweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of North America. It thrives in harsh, cold environments and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, silver-gray leaves covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers are tiny, white or pale pink, and appear in clusters, contributing to its delicate appearance. Drymaria jenniferae plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky and barren areas.
